question: [97.113(b)] Which of the following must be true before amateur stations may provide communications to broadcasters for dissemination to the public?

answers.b: B. The communications must be approved by a local emergency preparedness official and conducted on officially designated frequencies

answers.b: B. When it is unintentionally transmitted from the background at the transmitter

answers.d: D. Only "10 codes" are permitted

answers.d: D. 200 watts PEP output

answers.d: D. The portion above 29.5 MHz

question: Which sideband is most commonly used for voice communications on frequencies of 14 MHz or higher?

answers.c: C. Vestigial sideband
answers.d: D. Double sideband

question: Which of the following modes is most commonly used for voice communications on the 160, 75, and 40 meter bands?

answers.b: B. Lower sideband
answers.c: C. Vestigial sideband
answers.d: D. Double sideband

question: Which of the following is most commonly used for SSB voice communications in the VHF and UHF bands?

answers.b: B. Lower sideband
answers.c: C. Vestigial sideband
answers.d: D. Double sideband

answers.b: B. Lower sideband
answers.c: C. Vestigial sideband
answers.d: D. Double sideband

answers.b: B. Double sideband
answers.c: C. Single sideband
answers.d: D. Phase modulation

question: Which of the following is an advantage when using single sideband as compared to other analog voice modes on the HF amateur bands?

answers.a: A. Very high fidelity voice modulation
answers.b: B. Less bandwidth used and higher power efficiency

answers.a: A. Only one sideband and the carrier are transmitted the other sideband is suppressed
answers.b: B. Only one sideband is transmitted the other sideband and carrier are suppressed
answers.c: C. SSB voice transmissions have higher average power than any other mode
answers.d: D. SSB is the only mode that is authorized on the 160, 75 and 40 meter amateur bands

question: Which of the following is a recommended way to break into a conversation when using phone?

answers.a: A. Say "QRZ" several times followed by your call sign
answers.b: B. Say your call sign during a break between transmissions from the other stations
answers.c: C. Say "Break. Break. Break." and wait for a response

answers.b: B. Lower sideband is the only sideband legal on these frequency bands
answers.c: C. Because it is fully compatible with an AM detector
answers.d: D. Current amateur practice is to use lower sideband on these frequency bands

question: Which of the following statements is true of SSB VOX operation?

answers.a: A. The received signal is more natural sounding
answers.b: B. VOX allows "hands free" operation
answers.c: C. Frequency spectrum is conserved

question: What does the expression "CQ DX" usually indicate?

answers.a: A. A general call for any station
answers.b: B. The caller is listening for a station in Germany
answers.c: C. The caller is looking for any station outside their own country
answers.d: D. A distress call

question: Which of the following is true concerning access to frequencies?

answers.c: C. No one has priority access to frequencies, common courtesy should be a guide
answers.d: D. Contest operations must always yield to non-contest use of frequencies

question: What is the first thing you should do if you are communicating with another amateur station and hear a station in distress break in?

answers.a: A. Continue your communication because you were on frequency first
answers.b: B. Acknowledge the station in distress and determine what assistance may be needed
answers.c: C. Change to a different frequency
answers.d: D. Immediately cease all transmissions

question: If propagation changes during your contact and you notice increasing interference from other activity on the same frequency, what should you do?

answers.a: A. Tell the interfering stations to change frequency
answers.b: B. Report the interference to your local Amateur Auxiliary Coordinator
answers.c: C. As a common courtesy, move your contact to another frequency

question: When selecting a CW transmitting frequency, what minimum frequency separation should you allow in order to minimize interference to stations on adjacent frequencies?

answers.b: B. 150 to 500 Hz
answers.c: C. 1 to 3 kHz
answers.d: D. 3 to 6 kHz

question: What is the customary minimum frequency separation between SSB signals under normal conditions?

answers.b: B. Approximately 3 kHz
answers.c: C. Approximately 6 kHz
answers.d: D. Approximately 10 kHz

question: What is a practical way to avoid harmful interference when selecting a frequency to call CQ on CW or phone?

answers.a: A. Send "QRL?" on CW, followed by your call sign or, if using phone, ask if the frequency is in use, followed by your call sign
answers.b: B. Listen for 2 minutes before calling CQ
answers.c: C. Send the letter "V" in Morse code several times and listen for a response

question: Which of the following complies with good amateur practice when choosing a frequency on which to initiate a call?

question: What is the 'DX window' in a voluntary band plan?

answers.b: B. An FCC rule that prohibits contacts between stations within the United States and possessions on that band segment
answers.c: C. An FCC rule that allows only digital contacts in that portion of the band

question: [97.407(a)] Who may be the control operator of an amateur station transmitting in RACES to assist relief operations during a disaster?

answers.b: B. Only a RACES net control operator

answers.d: D. Any control operator when normal communication systems are operational

answers.c: C. Only when all amateur stations are instructed to stop transmitting

answers.b: B. Automatic keyers are used to send Morse code instead of hand keys
answers.c: C. An operator must activate a manual send/receive switch before and after every transmission

question: What should you do if a CW station sends "QRS"?

answers.c: C. Increase your power
answers.d: D. Repeat everything twice

question: What does it mean when a CW operator sends "KN" at the end of a transmission?

answers.c: C. Listening only for a specific station or stations
answers.d: D. Closing station now

question: What does it mean when a CW operator sends "CL" at the end of a transmission?

answers.b: B. Operating full break-in
answers.c: C. Listening only for a specific station or stations
answers.d: D. Closing station

question: What is the best speed to use answering a CQ in Morse Code?

answers.b: B. The speed at which the CQ was sent

answers.b: B. Operating split to avoid interference on frequency
answers.c: C. Sending without error
answers.d: D. Matching your transmit frequency to the frequency of a received signal.

question: When sending CW, what does a 'C' mean when added to the RST report?

answers.b: B. Report was read from S meter reading rather than estimated
answers.c: C. 100 percent copy
answers.d: D. Key clicks

question: What prosign is sent to indicate the end of a formal message when using CW?

answers.b: B. BK
answers.c: C. AR
answers.d: D. KN

question: What does the Q signal "QSL" mean?

answers.b: B. We have already confirmed by card
answers.c: C. I acknowledge receipt
answers.d: D. We have worked before

question: What does the Q signal "QRQ" mean?

answers.b: B. Send faster
answers.c: C. Zero beat my signal
answers.d: D. Quitting operation

question: What does the Q signal 'QRV' mean?

answers.a: A. You are sending too fast
answers.b: B. There is interference on the frequency
answers.c: C. I am quitting for the day
